intro: Blepharipappus chrysanthemoides, commonly known as the yellow coneflower, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open areas such as prairies and meadows, and it thrives in well-drained soils. Its flowers are yellow and resemble those of chrysanthemums, hence its common name. The plant is also known for its showy, daisy-like appearance and its role in supporting pollinators.
